summary_comment: Professor Bucknam is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and engaging lectures, which are both informative and entertaining, often incorporating personal anecdotes from her time in the CIA. She emphasizes clear communication and offers extensive support through office hours, helping students improve their writing and understanding of the material. Her grading is rigorous but fair, with a focus on a few key assignments that, when completed diligently, can lead to high grades.
summary_comment_short: Professor Bucknam is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and engaging lectures, which are both informative and entertaining, drawing from her experience in the CIA. Students consistently praise her clarity in assigning grades and providing guidance, making it possible to achieve high marks with consistent effort and attendance at her office hours.

Ratings.comment: Great professor- your grade is determined by only a few things, mostly papers. However it's fairly easy to do well if you go to her office hours and attend class. Everything you need to know for the midterm is in the lectures, which are entertaining- she uses anecdotes from her time in the CIA- and class almost always ends early. Highly recommend.

Anita is an AMAZING professor who gives really good insights on the national intelligence system and intelligence as a whole. She gives really good lectures and as long as you take good notes you will be fine. There are only a few graded assignments but as long as you go to her office hours she will help you correct or improve your work.

If you want to work in the IC, you need to take 5703. Anita's lectures are straightforward and memorable every time. She challenges you to improve your writing skills and if you use her as a resource, you will improve.

Professor Bucknam is by far the best professor I have had at Ohio State. She is a tough grader but she will tell you exactly what you need to do in order to get an A. Go to her office hours and ask her questions because she is a well of knowledge.

Ms. Bucknam is extremely sweet and is definitely someone to talk to with interests in working as an intelligence officer/analyst for the government. She provides clear directions to all assignments and is great to talk to outside of class if you have questions about career and professional opportunities. I would take her class in a heartbeat again.

Professor Bucknam clearly loves teaching about Intelligence work, and has lots of interesting stories. Easy midterm and quiz, three short intelligence style papers, a short briefing, and a long final paper. The intelligence style papers are difficult, but if you ask she will help you and tell you what to write.

There are 3 CIA-style briefings (one page long), a lengthy final paper, and a quick and easy presentation. She tells fascinating stories of her time with the CIA. Also, make sure to go to her office hours! She will walk you through each paper to make sure you get an A. About 60% of my class got an A overall, 40% got a B.

Professor Bucknam is a true expert in her field and is very good at communicating the realities of modern day intelligence work. She is a kind person and is genuinely interested in seeing her students succeed. Be sure to visit her office hours for help with her papers.
Professor Bucknam is my favorite professor ive had so far, and really cares about her students. Shes very helpful in office hours and shes passionate about her lectures and theyre pretty interesting!

The class itself consists of solely lectures with no slides or images, which does tend to get boring, but she is an ex-CIA agent who shares multiple stories during the lectures. The class is only graded on a couple of things, and the three papers are difficult, but she will help you so much during office hours. There is a presentation.

Professor Bucknam extends her office hours regularly and is always willing to meet you after and outside of class to help on assignments. Take advantage of this! Though attendance is not mandatory, I highly encourage going, as she has an optional quiz at the end based on them that could save your grade (it replaces one of the paper grades).

She's a wonderful friendly lady with a vast amount of experience in the CIA and many stories to go along with it. HOWEVER, she is probably one of the hardest graders I have ever had. Papers are assigned to be written in an unfamiliar style. LONG final paper instead of a final. Also, no powerpoints for lectures and she talks really fast.

Go to office hours!!! Lectures are long and boring, and she doesn't have slides to display or post. However, midterm and quiz were easy. Papers did not seem difficult but you have to go to her office hours. She will tell you exactly what to write to get an A. Had interesting stories about the CIA.
Go to her office hours with your paper/ideas and she'll tell you exactly what she wants and how to write it

This class was way over my head. I was excited when I found out papers are a page long but I received Ds or Fs on my papers that I thought were well written! Its awesome she worked for the CIA so I was excited for her class but she's an extremely tough grader. I went to her for help with my papers and she didn't give good feedback. Dropped class.

Great class taught by a great instructor. First class taken in my Security and Intel major, very impressed by the amount of information Anita covered using her personal experience and unique background. Nice and funny, and always willing to help during office hours. Not an easy A, but if you put the effort in you will be fine.

She assigns hard papers (PDB's; Presidential Daily Briefings). Though the papers are tough to get a hang of, she is very helpful in office hours. She is probably the best, most inspirational professor I have had while at OSU. She really wants to see her students exceed. She also has great stories from the CIA!

Really cool that she has background experience with the CIA. Very helpful with papers and lets you go into her office hours where she will read over the actual paper and tell you exactly what to change in order to do well. Lectures can be boring, but overall its a good class.

Professor Bucknam's class is great. She starts off with discussing current events which really helps keep you informed of what's going on in the world. The papers are very reasonable and you don't have to do much of the reading to do good on exams. Just pay attention and participate in class, and go to office hours for help.

One of the best professors I've had at OSU.  Lectures were always interesting, and writing assignments were pertinent and graded very fairly.  It's not hard to get an A if you pay attention, specifically to feedback on papers.  You don't have to do any of the readings to do well in the class.

The best advice for this class is to go to office hours. The content of the class is interesting and not difficult to understand, but the papers can be tricky if you try to do it on your own. She is looking for specific points. Overall, the class is enjoyable.
Midterm/quizzes very fair. Papers can be really hard to know what she is looking for. Overall a really good teacher, you will learn a lot if you go to class.

Informative; very clear as to what she wants to impart; very encouraging as to class participation; she will help you open your eyes to what is going on in the world; a real benefit is that she attracts a group of students who are interested in the field, some with military backgrounds, which adds to the quality of the discussion

Bucknam was an enjoyable teacher.  I didn't care much for the writing assignments, but she seemed to grade them fairly.  The midterm and final paper were very easy if you paid attention and thought about what she said in class.

Professor Bucknam clearly has a deep understanding of not only her class' subject area but the importance of it in the world. She is engaging, interesting, and always willing to help guide students when they encounter difficulties. While her class is long, it is always interesting and engaging. Take a class with her if you can - you won't regret it

She is ex-CIA intel analyst so she's very helpful if you want to know anything about intel or the CIA but not very helpful about other intel agencies...tried to tell me the DEA can not arrest people. very nice lady. recommended

Great professor... very clear in expectations... go to class... take notes.... do the readings up until the midterm... you will learn a lot... you will need to work hard but getting an A is not too difficult and this class is very rewarding.
A great teacher and a great person!

Very fair and fun class.  Very focused on current events and how to analyze these events.  Papers are difficult to write and require that you think outside the box.  Midterm is not too difficult but you need to study.  Professor Bucknam is always willing to help; go to class and you will do fine.

Excellect lecturer!  I really enjoyed both of her classes and loved the discussion.  There is a lot of writing, but once you get used to the style she wants it is doable.  The reading isn't necessary, but if you're interested, it is very informative.  Go to her office hours when you can, she gives great advice and is easy to talk to.

Great instructor, very interesting, go to class and pay attention and you should get a B.  Not difficult to get an A and you learn a lot.  This is how all classes should be conducted: Learn a lot and very possible to get a good grade.  Take this professor.

summary_comment: Professor Lewis is highly regarded for his extensive knowledge and engaging humor, particularly among students who have taken multiple courses with him. However, his classes are noted for being demanding, with extensive reading and essay-based assessments. While some students find the workload challenging and criticize his grading and class management, many appreciate the depth of learning and the opportunity to engage with complex historical topics.
summary_comment_short: Professor Lewis is highly knowledgeable and genuinely engaging, particularly appreciated by students who enjoy deep dives into history and international studies. However, his classes are noted for being extremely demanding, with extensive readings and challenging essay assignments that some find overwhelming.

Ratings.comment: The workload is too much for a general ed class. But, if you truly like history, this class has a lot to offer. I learned more in this class than I've ever learned in a history class. Since there are only essays, many of the textbook readings can be skimmed. I recommend fully reading the supplemental readings as I got the most out of them.

This class requires a ton of work, with dense lectures, numerous readings, and 3-4 essay exams. While challenging, using resources like Unstuck ai for study prep can help manage the workload. Prioritize this class over others to succeed.

not a good teacher AT ALL does not grade well, impossible to understand lectures, and does not care about students when they are going through something in their personal life. try to avoid his classes at all costs.

Dr.Lewis is an awful professor. He would cancel class last minute. His PowerPoint would have slides that were over 100+ and go off topic for half of the class. On top he will make you redo the whole assignment for no reason then dock you points for “being late”. DONT TAKE HIS CLASS!!!

He is by far the worst professor Ohio State has on staff. How he's still employed is a mystery and a travesty. He grades without any real rubric, based entirely on vibes. This class also means nothing and is just a required GE. He's one of those professors that thinks you should spend all your time on his class. Disgrace to professors everywhere.

This professor is extremely knowledgeable on the topics he is teaching, but does not have realistic expectations for this undergraduate course. The readings are many and extremely long. He has way too many criteria in his essay prompts to fit the maximum word limit. It is nearly impossible to encompass all that he is asking for in his assignments.

I have absolutely enjoyed both International Studies 3701 and 4700 with Jeffrey Lewis. He is so knowledgeable on the course topics and genuinely so funny, and I love his dad humor. Both of courses I have taken with him were writing-heavy, but I prefer essays to exams. Overall, this professor has taught me so much.

First of all, Jeffery is one of my favorite International Studies teachers. I have taken two classes with him so far, and hope to take more. He has the funniest dad humor and is so intelligent in his field. While he is a tough grader, I have learned so much from him.

Professor Lewis is overall a tough grader. His expectations are completely unrealistic and with how his class is structured, it is almost impossible to do what he asks because the readings are extremely long. His due dates are also insane with due dates at 10am. He also randomly assigns his papers, so if you do not check his page you will miss them

If there was a zero-star rating, I'd be smashing that button faster than a kid in a candy store. The expectations for this class are as realistic as a flying pig. This course is set up so you have no time for anything else. He set this class up with expectations of a graduate class. The readings are longer than a Costco receipt of a mother of 5.

Worst class I have ever taken in my life. Mistake taking it with him especially during summer. TONS of readings on top of 3-4.5 hours of lecture each week. Has 3 midterm essays and a final, the first one expected you to basically condense a month's worth of material with only 1 week to write it. Do NOT recommend. Every week felt like I was drowning
Wow my advisor said this was going to be bad and I guess he was right. He expects you to read hundreds of pages of text books but don't worry he has pictures for every page......

I'm extremely disappointed with how this class ended. We ran out of time to cover all the material, so rather than let it be, during the last 3 weeks of school he's assigned supplemental readings, and two 1500 essays. All due during finals. He's the type of prof who expects you to prioritize his class even though its a GE. Would not recommend.
This class is way too much work for a GE. Honestly, I would change this class from 3 credit hours to 5.

Extremely boring lectures and readings, the class is made up of "biweekly" reading assignments that roughly cover the material, along with three midterm exams of 1500 words each. On top of that, the final exam is two 1500 word papers, one that covers the last part of the material and one that covers the ENTIRE class. Not worth it for a GE.

This is the more information dense class I've ever taken. During the essay midterms, you'll be expected to summarize the whole unit with a small word limit, and failing to mention really niche details will TANK your grade. The final is TWO  1500 word essays, which is absolutely cruel and insane, considering that this is a GE class.

How Dr. Lewis is still employed is beyond me, this man is without a doubt the WORST professor I've ever had. There is no clear grading guidelines, so he just gives grades based on vibes. Meaning, if you're not one of his chosen few, you're not getting an A. I started skipping like halfway through because I couldn't take the condescension anymore.

Some of the reviews from this semester seemed a bit harsh. There is a lot of readings and very few assignments; however, supplemental readings basically supplanted the textbook, as I barely read it and did fine. HOWEVER two essays for a final is unforgivable. Pick one -- covering the last unit or the whole semester. Can't have both.
does not make respect visible!

Normally I wait until final grades are posted, but this prof just SUCKS. There was an instance during the beginning of the semester where I had to go to a funeral, and he refused to give me a extension, and he held a grudge against me for the rest of the year.

Dear reader, I know you're looking at that 5 level difficulty and thinking, "Well, I'm built different!" and I'm here to tell you, no you are not. This class was genuinely so horrible in terms of workload that I got a vitamin D deficiency from how much time I spent indoors working on it.

This is the class that broke me. I'm a junior, and this was the first class that ever made me adopt the "it is what it is" attitude because of the sheer difficulty of this course. Putting in 10 hours of work will get you the same grade as 3 hours of work. Prides himself on not giving out 'easy A's". Don't take this class unless you have to!

Dr. Lewis has got to be the most conceited professor I've ever had the displeasure of taking. On all of your written assignments, you MUST agree with him, and you MUST use the same logic as him, and you MUST not have any original thoughts at all. The only problem? His lectures are so long/monotonous, you'll spend 3 hours searching for 1 sentence.
Dr. Lewis throws tons of work w/ impossible deadlines & no grading guide.  Lectures felt like showing off, not teaching. Unclear feedback left us lost. Don't take this class!

Your only grades in this class comes from five 10 page papers, of which you get a week to write. Absolutely insane. This guy has no clear grading rubric, and is one of the toughest graders I've EVER had! I'm an English major, so writing is kind of my whole thing, but I never got above a B+ on my papers. TL;DR this prof sucks

I wish I could drop my SEI that was over 3000 words of how much I hated Dr. Lewis. I simply couldn't whatever I did, get decent grades on his papers. No clear rubric. I'm a strong writer, but if your paper does not meet his biblical like expectations, prepare to receive mark offs for any little mistake. Horrible student-prof relationship, horrible.

I took this class as a GE, thinking that it would be a fun little overview of European History. I couldn't have been more wrong. This course is like 12 AP classes in one, in terms of the workload, and the prof is a sad middle aged man who doesn't care about students at all. Avoid him if you can.
OSU fire this guy challenge

I hated this class with every fiber of my being and used to literally sob when he assigned essays because I knew no matter how much time/effort I put into them, I was going to get a B- max (I don't think he ever gave anyone A's). Cheers to this hell of a class being over!

I'm a STEM student, and I ended up putting in more time for this class than I did my ochem hw. He assigns a ridiculously amount of work and gives you no time to complete them. He always talks about his special interests, which aren't that important to the class concepts.

IS 4852. Kind of rude and thinks he knows everything - won't let you finish asking a question before he tries to answer. doesnt have clear grading criteria but will mark off for whatever even we we asked for a rubric. smart guy, class has a lot of good info, but him himself I wouldn't take again. he has just gotten worse every time Ive have him

Dr. Lewis is, without a doubt, the worst professor I've ever had. His lectures are nothing but white text on a black background, and he just drones on and one with no class participation or checking to see if we follow. You have to read 2 textbook chapters a week, and theres additional readings on top of that! Too much work, too little time.

Most information dense class I've taken in the major, hundreds of pages of reading a week, harsh midterm grader. Professor is very knowledgeable and passionate about the field and WMDs, loves to discuss or talk in and around class.

You will learn a lot from Dr. Lewis, but man is it hard to get A's on the papers. If you are an excellent writer, this class is for you, and he definitely prepares you well for the papers, but 3 major papers and a final is about the only grades you'll get so it is hard to clutch an A with the way he grades.

I honestly loved his lectures and found them interesting. But he assigns so many long essays and only gives you 2 days to write them. Probably one of the toughest essay graders I have ever encountered too, and he is not even an english teacher. You HAVE to show up to every lecture to be able to perform well on the essay style midterms.

I realized I finally needed to file for disability because he taught so awfully on Western Europe (which ive been learning since middle school) which I LOVE the topic, but it was so bad that I mentally could not write any SIMPLE 1500 word paper without a breakdown. I could not care enough.

I havent been in this guys classes for 3 weeks and I cannot listen to a word he says. Its just constant rambling and the slides are white text paragraphs on black backdrops. I swear that I do my very best to listen because my grades are so important, but he just goes on and on with no real point. 
Been in 3 different classes of his, all the same.

Great professor, very good lectures. Loved the class, only thing is tons of reading, but a lot of the readings were very good and engaging!
Time consuming class and work but great content and professor. Will be trying to have him again!

He is one of the hardest graders I have ever encountered. He doesn't have a consistent grading rubric and takes a lot of points off for minor details. I have never worked so hard in a class and had little to show for it. I hope to never have to take another of his classes again.

For a 3 credit hour class there is so much reading. You don't have enough time to read and watch the lecture videos before you hit a paper assignment. It's a lot to balance with other classes. Don't ask for too many extensions, even valid reasons (like a funeral) may not be good enough to get you what you need to succeed. Good luck.

Overall a good professor, but his class requires a significant time commitment and can be very hard. There are a lot of readings for a 3 credit hour, and they're important for the papers--if you don't think you'll have time to do the readings, don't take this class.

I've had three courses with Dr. Lewis and in each one I've learned more than in most of my other courses combined. All of his classes are intense and eat up more time than you would expect from a 3 credit hour course. Still, if you are willing to put in the necessary work, there are few better professors out there.

Expect to put in a lot of work on these papers. The final was a doozy- basically writing two heavy papers. Lectures are interesting and I learned a lot. Was skeptical about this class coming in but found it to go deeper than expected.

Listen, I like a nice easy going professor. This guy is not it. When you try hard and read all the 50+ pages he expects you to read for a paper and still don't receive an A, I'd say this guy grades hard. He expects you to cover a lot of material within a 2-3 page paper so be prepared to write an excellent paper. I pray I don't have to run into him

Okay so based on my tags it might seem like I didn't love Dr. Lewis but it's the complete opposite! This was my second class I took with him and I liked it a lot better than 4700. The material is so interesting and there are 3 midterm papers and a long final paper. I put in a good deal of effort and it paid off, I loved learning from him.

4000's level course or not, no one has time to read 300 pages in a single week. He will assign entire 30-page chapters for you to read when there will only be a few specific pages of relevant information within the assignments. He expects us to sift through loads of irrelevant information when he doesn't even do that in his own lectures.

He's very passionate and knowledgable about what he teaches, but if youre not good at writing papers then you should avoid this class. 5 papers, 2 pages each and 8 page final. Very difficult topics, very difficult to get A's on them. He gave us alot of reading (made us buy 5 books) on which the papers are based on. His handwriting is illegible too.

I have never met a teacher who was so polarizing. Some people hate him, others love him. This class was very interesting, and Lewis knows what he is talking about. His lectures can be boring but he is crazy smart. There are 4 papers a semester and then a final paper. He assigns long readings but you only need to skim to write the papers.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS. Do not take this class unless you absolutely have to. The lectures are boring and not interactive. You'll have to write 5 papers over the course of the semester and you will basically teach yourself all the material. His handwriting is absolutely ILLEGIBLE but yet he still writes all over your papers and expects you to read it.

Do not take this class if you don't have to. It is a waste of time. You'll read a couple chapters out of the 4 or 5 books he assigns. Your grade is based on 5 papers and a final that is really just an additional 2 papers itself. The lectures consist of him reading off 60+ slide powerpoints and he puts them all online anyway. Avoid at all costs.

He knows his stuff, but lectures are boring and difficult to pay attention to with only a brief outline to guide his thoughts. Lots of detail-oriented papers, must quote the readings. Tough grader on papers, and his handwriting is not legible even though he writes all over them. Nice guy but did not get much out of the class.

Dr. Lewis takes attendance for the first few classes, and after that I recommend not to bother going. Class was based on readings and his lectures, both of which made me fall asleep. For the papers just skim the readings, pick out some direct quotes, and use his PowerPoint slides (which he puts online). Easy class if you know how to write papers.

Dr. Lewis is very knowledgeable and an adequate lecturer. The class consisted of only 6 short reflection papers and a longer final paper but in order to do well on them you definitely have to go to lecture and I would recommend reading the material. The books were interesting and easy to read. It wasn't difficult but not much to rave about either.

Don't get me wrong he was very knowledgeable about Terrorism, but I got nothing out of the lectures. It didn't matter how many times you went to class, the information was in the reading and you practically had to draw it all out yourself. His writing is eligible and his lectures are very monotonous. Get ready to read and research A LOT.

Don't take this class if you aren't good at writing papers. There were only six grades for the entire semester, including the final, and they were all difficult papers. He knows what he is talking about and is very passionate during lecture, but I just hate the way he assesses and grades the students.

Very knowledgeable professor and respected, but somehow makes a dynamic topic boring at times. Lectures can help on papers but other times feel pointless and aren't mandatory. Graded on 5 papers and a final consisting of 3 papers. These papers ask for a lot for being only 3 pages each; do all the readings. He's a very tough but fair grader.

Prof. Lewis is a walking textbook! This man is very knowledgable on the subjects he teaches. Classes are comprised of just lecture, so if you may get lost easily if you don't pay attention. 5 papers and 1 big final paper. A lot of daily readings and all of them are absolutely essential. Not an easy class but you will definitely learn a lot!

Professor Lewis was very knowledgable about the subject matter, but lectured with a poor sense of direction. I was unaware of what information was important and what was not. He expects you to have prior knowledge about terrorism, so if you don't, I would not recommend. I'm very disappointed and thought this would be an interesting  class.

write good papers, get a good grade. going to class isn't SUPER important, but it 100% makes writing the papers easier. prompts are always detailed and clear. good class, but also pretty boring despite such a dynamic subject

Had this professor for class a few times but I knew what I was getting into. Everything he teaches applies to my study so if you are thinking about taking any of his classes just for fun make sure you like the material he will be covering. The lectures are long, and he does go on tangents, but it's easy to ignore the extra info.

Dr. Lewis is a great guy.  Have to work for the A, but all the resources are available to be successful (the books and Carmen readings). No exams, only 5 three-page papers and an eight-page final paper. Must cite everything in the papers which can be time consuming, but really makes sure you learn the material. One of my favorite classes thus far.

The man's knowledge of his subject matter is incredible. He's like a walking talking textbook at times. If you find the subject interesting, this is a plus, if not, his lectures will be long. He loves starting group discussions though, so that will break it up. Readings are long, but as long as you throw in a few references in the papers, not hard.

He lectures from start to finish, goes extremely fast, but definitely knows what he is talking about. You have to right a handful of papers that require you to attend lectures and do the readings-he is a tough grader. Also, the readings are SUPER long and dry. You will learn a lot, but have to work really, really hard if you want an A.

Because he knows so much about the topic lectures can drag on, although this can be helpful for writing your papers if you can pay attention for that long. I liked his paper topics and the content although the readings were tedious and hard to get through.

I hated this class. There was a ridiculous amount of reading assigned and papers were tedious because you couldn't use outside sources for info. He gave way too many frivolous details in lectures, talked to fast, and was impossible to keep up with. I felt like I was in a science class sometimes. He's a very tedious man. At least he's hot though.

Excellent professor who is obviously fascinated with his subject. There's a lot of writing and reading to be done, but he's willing to review drafts before submission. The lectures are long, but he never makes it feel tedious.

Great teacher who loves what he is talking about. Took his terrorism class over summer and lectures got to be really long and kind of boring. However if you do the readings the paper topics are fairly easy if you put in effort! I learned a lot of interesting things from the class and would take him again!

Dr. Lewis is super knowledgable in terrorism, which sometimes means his lectures can get boring as he get bogged down in the details. Attendance isn't mandatory but the readings are! Most are on carmen but there are a few books (super cheap on Chegg). You have to write a 2-3 page paper for 57 topics from the readings and a final paperno tests.

Dr. Lewis was excellent. Being a historian by training, he came to teach this class out of his own interest, and it shows. He rarely speaks in definite terms, instead encouraging students to think for themselves and form their own opinions. One of my favorite classes and professors.

Great professor.  Presents material well, engages the class in good discussions, it obviously interested in the subject and enthusiastic about teaching it, and overall is quite likable.  If you're looking for a course with low work levels, go elsewhere.  If you're looking for a good course taught by a prof who likes what he teaches, you've found it

I'm not even sure how a poor rating is possible. I took 4 classes from Professor Lewis and learned more in one lecture than I did in the whole of other classes. He is demanding but fair. Go to class you won't regret it. I wasn't even a great student of his as I had my business to run while in school and I still learned more than in other courses.

Dr. Lewis is a great teacher!! I would advise you to never skip a class because his lectures are incredibly informative. The readings are supplementary to the lectures, he usually doesn't  lecture exactly what you have read, so if you miss class you miss a lot. Grade is entirely based on papers, but if you put in the work he is a fair grader
A phenomenal professor who is very obviously an expert on his subject. I would recommend to anyone looking to take International Studies courses.
He assigns a ton of reading.  All of the grades come from papers and attendance.  Nice guy.  He doesn't really respond to emails.

Class is entirely lecture-based, with no time for discussion, even when current events directly relate to class. All the grades for the class are from papers over the readings. The lectures are almost useless, I only referenced them a few times on the final paper.  When he lectures, he somehow makes a very interesting topic seem very boring.

Dr. Lewis is one of the best professors I have had at OSU. Its true that you will learn more in one lecture than in 10 weeks of some other courses, and he is a fairly hard grader for the papers - which by the way is your entire grade, there are no tests.  There is a lot of reading, but its well worth it

Terror & Terrorism was the first class that I took with Dr. Lewis. It is a pleasure to take his courses. There is a lot of reading, the lectures are detailed - but in just one class you will learn more on a topic than most do in an entire quarter on a subject. I went on a 45 minute tangent myself about the material he covered in just one class.
Very interesting well spoken professor. Prof. Lewis knows this subject backwards and forwards and does a great job and teaching. It also helps that he is very easy on the eyes.

Very good professor. Definitely an expert in his field, and lectures are quite interesting. He's engaging and very approachable. Can be a tough grader but gives very specific guidelines regarding what he wants in papers. Readings are important, but you can get by as long as you skim over them. Highly recommended.

Really enjoyed this class! Dr. Lewis clearly knows his stuff. He was a tough paper grader, but was happy to discuss them with you (which is necessary because his handwriting's awful). He's pretty approachable, and I'd take a class with him again. Put in the time to do the readings, put in the time for papers, you'll be fine!

Dr. Lewis is one of the best teachers I've ever had. He does require a lot of reading but the readings are extremely helpful to his lectures. His style of teaching is extremely in depth. I didn't do amazing in his class I got a B- but I learned a lot. I am taking his IS555 section this quarter and looking forward to it.

He is very interesting and knowledgeable, but lectures are very heavy & long. His handwriting is very frustrating because it is horrible. It is literally impossible to do all the readings with other classes, but have get the main ideas & use them A LOT in papers. Lecture is really only useful for the final paper; other papers are based on readings

He is very intelligent and informed but is challanging. He is a hard grader and expects you to be able to get a lot of information (lectures and reading) into the papers which he assigns every couple of weeks. The good thing about him is that if you realize you are doing poorly, he assigns enough to improve. his handwriting sucks though.

Knowledgeable and well-spoken prof. Lots of reading and a response paper to write every two weeks. Only complaint is that there is a five page paper due the last week of the class and a ten page paper due as your exam which makes the last two weeks very stressful and back-loaded.
Very interested in the material. He's a tough grader, but very helpful when you're writing a paper. I would take him again for his 553 class.

As an IS major I have never had a better IS teacher! That is not to say it's easy, very challenging but worth it! A published author of these subjects he is incredably well informed! Get ready for A LOT of good reading. Not for the fate of heart, take only one of his great classes at a time. Stay away if only kinda interested in topics. Amazing!!!!
Awesome teacher.  Extremely intelligent.  Learned alot.

Dr, lewis is one of the most Intelligent Professors i had at Ohio State, He knows the material and i think his lectures are very interesting. He has an amazingly amount of information about what he is teaching.he is a fair grader, not easy but not hard.Expect to do a lot of work, but it is worth it, you actually will learn something.

GOOD CLASS BUT BAD TEACHER! The class is easy but he makes it difficult. He is boring lecturer.  At the end you will get an A but you have learned nothing. Make sure you bring a billow with you to the lectures and consider your self warned.

Professor Lewis knows the material but totally doesn?t know how to put it together in a fashion that students might fellow and understand. He is kind of arrogant professor and treats students as an ignorant people. The class is easy but he makes it difficult. I have got in his class an A- and as long as u are ready reading a lot and listening to hi

I have taken three classes with Dr Lewis, and he  is amazing!  Ridiculously smart, and his classes are challenging but rewarding.  He assigns a lot of readings, but each has relevance in the grand scheme of each class, though you'll hear your classmates complain.  Take a class with him, talk with him; he's one of the best professors at OSU!

I've never taken an intl stds course before, and pulled out an A. Don't let people scare you. You don't neeed a backround in this stuff. You need to be able to read a good amount of informaiton and be able to synthesize it to make points in your papers. He is EXTREMELY knowledgeable about this subject. I was a little intimadated, but learned a lot.

Extremely knowledgeable; makes you work hard for your grade, but once your done you realize how much you have learned.  Would recommend only if you are Int Stds, otherwise you might get disenfranchised.  In all he is the BEST teacher I've had here at Ohio State.  A+++
He is not a very fair teacher.  When making an appointment to see him in his office, he has no consideration for the students scheduling and does not show up on time for his appointments.
Interesting material.  Make sure to read the assigned books to get the most out of it.  Papers were reasonable, but time-consuming.

One of my favorite classes so far, I would highly recommend.  He's very personable and conveys the subject matter well (in English!)  I'm not sure how tough I want to say he is--I read maybe 20% of what was assigned, payed attention in class, and got a B on each of my midterms and my final paper.

Good class, good prof. If you want to get an A you'll have to probably really work for it, but if you're cool with a B+/A- or so, then it's very reasonable. In-class work is almost negliglible, but put some serious effort into your papers, or it will show and he will notice. The class is worth taking and very interesting.

Another great class- WMD and tech. are clearly more related to his interests, but he does a fine job with the T&T material. You don't realize just how much you've learned until the end of the quarter. A lot of papers and reading, but the topics are highly interesting. Go to class, ask questions, talk to him during his OH...you won't regret it!

Definitely a lot of work, but well worth it. I learned a ton in his class, and wasn't too interested in the subject beforehand.  Some of the readings and the technical parts of the lectures were dry, but on the whole, a fascinating subject.  Lewis really cares about helping his students and is very accomodating during office hours.

As others have said - SLAVE DRIVER! But it's really worth it. You MUST carefully read 70+ pages per class. But the reading selections are fascinating. Papers are sometimes due on a weekly basis. But they really force you to think & grow. Very nice & caring instructor too. Loves discussion & questions. Would recommend for an otherwise light quarter.
No Comments
Very knowledgeable prof. Knows the subject thoroughly, and also helpful during office hours. I recommend him to anyone interested. Be prepared for a lot of reading, but it's definately worth it.

Enjoyed his class.  He knew his subject very well and was able to integrate his own feelings into the class and explanations.  Let you know exactly what he wanted on the papers you just had to back it up.

One of my favorite professors at OSU. His teaching method taught me not only the course material, but how to truly study, analyze and interpret. I wish I had him earlier in my college career. What I learned from him may have helped me improve my grades in other courses. I still try to keep in contact with him for advice in my current profession.

Absolutely phenomenal professor. Assignments make you think, especially the final one. No tests, just papers. But it seems like the papers help you understand the material more than any test you might take. Definitely recommend him!

Overall a good instructor when it came to the content of the class.  He is very arrogant and not very open to differing opinions.  He will straight up shoot you down in class if you raise an opposing point of view.  Not a hard grader if you do good work and seemed to respect people  who came to class and participated.
He is a bit arrogant but overall is a decent prof.
he knows what he's talking about... he rocks

This class is pretty interesting.  Lectures can get a little dry sometimes, but he makes it interesting.  Lots of reading but if you keep up on it you should have no problem getting an A.  And it's not totally necessary to go to all the class's.
Hes cool as hell, just grading is harsh!
Not a very good class if you do not have a International Studies background.  It's a lot of work and a lot of the essays depend on previous knowledge.

A LOT of reading in this class, so be prepared to read a 60-100 pages before the next class. Good thing is that his midterms and final are very interesting and they REALLY help you know the material. Also, he grades fairly easy, so it kind of balances the amount of reading that you do. Very good class overall and you learn a TON about national sec.

Intriguing. Lots of readings, but all were interesting and informative. The papers, even the final one, weren't too hard. There aren't a lot of guidlines for the paper, so he's open to whatever insights you have to offer. A very thoughtful professor.

Lectures were boring as hell and didn't have anything to do with the homework assignments, so the assigned work seemed HUGE to me. Weekly [short] papers in this class. He talks like a history professor but the class is not actually history, so it is confusing...
I have had him twice.  He is a great professor who has a genuine interest in teaching.  He is hard though; be prepared to work.  I would recommend this class to everyone.
The class was a lot of work, but well worth it! He knows his stuff and explains everything very clearly.

This guy is awesome.  Take classes with him look him up.  When you're oogling over 3 books and 15 research documents at 4am trying to piece together the hardest paper you've ever written, you'll fully appreciate what it is to be a college student.  I love it.
Teaches critical thinking, readings are very interesting!
Total history prof.  I can't stay awake to save my life.  Too many books and too many questions.  This guy is a SLAVEDRIVER!!!
Dr. Lewis is a ****.  he knows his stuff and his classes are very interesting.  Take some with this guy.  you won't be disappointed
extremely nice and helpful. take-home midterms and final (papers). Questions are somewhat difficult but he helps as much as he can. FUN classes!!

SEI.Class Name: The Development and Control of Weapons of Mass Destruction

SEI.Class Name: The Development and Control of Weapons of Mass Destruction
