summary_comment: Professor Puga is known for her rigorous yet supportive approach to teaching, with high expectations that encourage active participation and thorough understanding of the material. While some students find her classes demanding, particularly due to extensive reading and strict attendance policies, others appreciate her lenient grading and willingness to help students succeed, often citing her as an easy professor who provides ample opportunities for extra credit.
summary_comment_short: Professor Puga is known for her rigorous yet supportive approach, requiring students to engage actively in discussions and complete substantial reading, though many find the workload manageable. Students appreciate her care for their success and the availability of extra credit opportunities, though some criticize the high cost of required materials and strict attendance policies.

Ratings.comment: I took Dr. Puga's Spanish Literature class in Spring 2020. She had reasonable expectations, and she made an effort to make sure we understood the reading before we started analyzing. She does make you participate. There was a fair amount of reading, but it was doable. She graded leniently, and she definitely cared.

Worst professor at OSU.  She makes you buy drama books worth $200 and you don't even use all of them.  Her class is so awful; all you talk about is how liberal politics is tied into melodrama.  AVOID THIS PROFESSOR AT ALL COSTS. Also, you are counted absent if you forget your  book or if you forget to print a 70 pg pdf
All you have to do is read and create discussion questions

Ana Puga is a great professor to have for any GE. She is super "free" and easy-going. She WANTS everyone to do well in her class. If you do the readings before class and participate, you will be just fine. The quizzes are EXTREMELY straight forward if you write down what she says too. Tons of extra credit. Easy A, go to class.

SEI.Subject: SPANISH
SEI.Class Name: Introduction to Latino Literature in the U.S.

SEI.Subject: SPANISH
SEI.Class Name: Seminar in Latin American Literatures and Cultures

SEI.Subject: SPANISH
SEI.Class Name: Seminar in Latin American Literatures and Cultures

summary_comment: Professor Payind is highly regarded for his passion and knowledge about the Middle East, which he shares through engaging guest speakers and detailed exam preparation. However, his lectures often include tangents, making the class structure less formal and potentially leading to an unengaging experience for some students. Despite this, many find the class relatively easy, especially for those with prior knowledge, and emphasize the importance of attending early to gauge his teaching style.
summary_comment_short: Professor Payind is highly regarded for his passion and knowledge about the Middle East, which he shares through engaging guest speakers and detailed preparation for exams. However, his lectures can be overly tangential, making the class less structured and sometimes easier than expected, with some students finding it difficult to retain significant information.

Ratings.comment: He is very passionate about teaching and the middle east. He brought in great guest speakers from OSU for lectures about their area of expertise. He prepares you for exams by telling you what the possible essays may be about, so you can prepare ahead of time. I loved learning from Dr. Payind.
Loved this professor very passionate about the Middle East and very nice
I loved learning from Professor Payind.  He was so knowledgable and i appreciated his class and looked forward to it.

Take this class for the professor, not the content. Payind cares a ton about the subject matter, but goes off on far too many tangents to really result in a meaningful class experience. Don't stress too much about the readings. Just look up different topics on Wikipedia before exams and you should be fine.

If you know about the Mid East you could probably pass w/o showing up. Class was just lectures, he is passionate but goes off on tangents. Try to get the general info & you'll pass midterms. Ask him Qs after class so he gives a quick clear answer or he'll go on in class and forget your Q. Listen, take some notes, and show up to review day

Dr. Payind is the best professor I have ever had. He is so passionate about the Middle East and informing students about its history and current state. Likes to go on tangents and tell stories. The class consisted of 2 midterms and a final, all 30% of your grade. Don't buy the books, just take really good notes and you'll pass. TAKE THIS CLASS!!!

This class was very unstructured and pretty easy if you've taken a class or two on the Middle East before. He clearly knows a lot but isn't an effective lecturer. There are few assignments that make up your grade and he gives little to no feedback. It's easy but I didn't really learn much. People skipped a lot and you don't need the books.

Dr. Payind's class was unexpectedly easy. I went into his class thinking it would be like other history classes where you have all of these random class assignments but it was the complete opposite. Go to class until the first midterm to see what kind of professor he is and then you can skip at least once a week. Returned the textbook after 1 week.

Let me start of saying that Dr. Payind's personality as well as his actual teaching of the material have made me decide that I want to minor in International Studies of the Middle East. He is SO passionate about the Middle East, and is one of the smartest teachers I have ever had throughout my life. AMAZING PROFESSOR, AMAZING CLASS.

Dr. Payind is a phenomenal professor, who clearly has an extensive depth of knowledge of the Middle East. He is very enthusiastic about conveying that information to his students so they may develop well-informed, intelligent perspectives on the current conflicts and interactions in the Middle East.
the class was too easy. it's geared for people who know little to nothing about the middle east. dr. payind is a nice guy and very knowledgeable and passionate about the middle east

Brilliant guy, extremely knowledgeable about Middle East, but a bit scatterbrained. TA (Jennifer) always posts study guides for exams, definitely use them. Class moves fast and covers a lot of material, but worth it.

Dr. Payind is a great guy, very passionate about what he teaches. Had a lot of guest speakers who were great, but kind of made making sense of the notes confusing. The TA Jennifer is great and is super helpful and knowledgeable also.

Incredibly knowledgeable and passionate about his studies on the Middle East, and amazing professor!  His lectures and discussions acknowledge all perspectives, but he likes to impart on students the historical, cultural, and linguistic contexts of every topic.

One of the best teachers I have ever had at Ohio State. Even though attendance was mandatory, I enjoyed going to class. Understanding concepts and theories is a big part of the essay exams. He also has a great sense of humor!
Alam was one of the greatest professors I ever had. He has a passion for Middle Eastern studies and was fair and open minded in his views.

Prof. Payind is awesome, he knows the Middle East inside out. Occasionally a little unclear and distracted, but you'll love him all the more for it. Great sense of humor too. Had him for International Studies 245 and 645, no problems in either class. Highly recommended.
Professor Payind is a good man, smart...well educated...and silly at times.  One of my favorite Professors at the Ohio State University.

This class was awesome. A great introduction to the Middle East. But you have to have a sense of humor when you are in his lectures. Really knows what he's talking about and his TA Jennifer is great. The carmen site she has is really helpful.

Dr. Payind know his material exceptionally well. He is a very knowledgable professor. His writing is a bit hard to understand, but his test formats are clear cut. Studying for them is hard..it's almost like pulling needles out of a hay stack. However, the last midterm and the final were graded pretty easy since they were difficult.

Professor is very interested in course, willing to answer any questions. It's a bit hard to figure out what to study for the tests. Only takes attendance a few times a quarter. Writing is very hard to read.
great class. He is a very knowledgeable prof.  Knows more about the middle east than anyone.  Must take class!
Dr. Payind is a great man, good source of help. I thought tests were a little tricky but, he gives you plenty of options on test format. All in all a good class:)
Really knows his stuff and is a great resource. You get to learn so much more than what the U.S. media might present in his courses.
Very smart on the subject.  Is very willing to help, but if you don't speak up he'll move on to another subject.  Wants people to know more then what you see on the news about the Middle East.
Good class, the teacher is an expert and very knowledgeable and helpful. The midterm and finals are straightforward. Dr. Payind is a brillant and nice man.

Dr. Payind is an interesting man, he knows his stuff very well; he's very knowledgable. I learned a lot of important concepts from the class. The tests are easy if you just look over your vocab and notes.

Very knowledgable about past and current Middle East.  Can tell is interested in subject, always willing to answer questions.  Class interesting b/c other viewpts brought in from guest lecturers.  Writing is pretty difficult to read, goes too fast at end.
No Comments
He was a good teacher, interesting class.
An asset to Ohio State! This man is a wonderful professor!
excellent teacher, great class- very interesting!

SEI.Subject: INTSTDS
SEI.Class Name: Introduction to the Modern Middle East

SEI.Subject: INTSTDS
SEI.Class Name: Introduction to the Modern Middle East

summary_comment: Professor Nestorovamatejic is known for her rigorous grading standards and heavy reading assignments, making the class challenging but potentially rewarding. While some students found her lectures and class format engaging and appreciated her willingness to provide feedback, others criticized her teaching style as unclear and boring, suggesting that the class might be best suited for those deeply interested in the subject matter. Overall, her classes require significant effort and dedication to succeed.
summary_comment_short: Professor Nestorovamatejic is known for being a challenging grader with rigorous expectations, particularly in terms of citations and formatting, and often receives mixed reviews regarding her teaching style. While some students appreciate her detailed knowledge and engaging storytelling, others find her lectures and grading criteria confusing and her classes overly demanding.

Ratings.comment: One of the worst professors I have had. Do not take her class she does not understand the material she is teaching. Honestly, if you do you would be better off doing the readings and not going.
Dr.Nestorova provided a nuanced perspective about Russian politics. She kept the class entertained by include silly images in the power point slides or tell us personal stories from her youth.

There are several readings a week for this course and they are typically pretty heavy topics. She is a very hard grader (make sure font for presentation are +14pt font, every line is cited from the text, follows the format of the reading). She is willing to edit and help. TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THIS. I learned so much in this class! Definitely take it.

The most difficult grader I've ever had. Gives extremely vague prompts for papers and then deducts points for not including the most specific things. Her lectures are boring and honestly you could have learned the same material just by reading a book/watching a documentary. Avoid at all costs.
Harsh grader. Is not clear enough about what she wants for essays. Difficult to succeed.

If you are not interested in foreign affairs/history this is not a good class to take. This was the hardest GE class I've had to take. There's a lot of reading, a lot of papers, and she has no clear guide lines for her papers. The only way to do well on papers is to cite the books assigned as much as you can in papers.

She knows a lot but does not communicate it clearly and rambles. Posts all slides online which you would be better off studying on your own but you have to go to class. Midterm and final are take home 5 page papers with a 5 page current event research paper. All rely on the chapters she assigns from various books. She doesn't grade them very easily

Not a fun class. The content was repetitive and she doesn't lecture. You and your classmates create power points and do lectures on readings. You do carmen responses every day for homework. Though Children and War was an interesting topic, the class was boring and tedious.
very very tough grader

Dr. Nestorova is a great professor.  She uses the lens of soccer to provide a deeper understanding of globalization and comes to each class excited to teach.  She takes a genuine interest if you are motivated to learn.  Taking another class with her in the future.

No "midterms" - just a few papers. You can tell she is really passionate about this area of study, especially since she is from Bulgaria. She knows her stuff and can communicate it very clearly. Would take again.
She's great with language participation.

Her lectures could get boring, but it didn't stop me from enjoying the class. She was very passionate about what she was teaching and, growing up in a Soviet Bloc country, was very knowledgeable. She may nitpick on the assignments, but that's not reflected by the overall grade. However, you have to know how to write a decent paper to do well.
Nice lady but lectures are very boring and mostly on the reading that you already did. Tough grader.

Dr Nestorova is a very sweet lady, accent is not too thick to understand, and I didn't try very hard and ended up with a B+. She basically gave us all the info she wanted to see in our papers, you just have to go to class.

She is NOT  as difficult of a grader as everyone is saying. Yes, she likes to nitpick on details in essays, but it didn't reflect in the overall grade. It's college, you're expected to write a coherent paper and she wants you to cite your textbooks. She can be boring during lectures, but she is very knowledgeable.

Dr. N is definitely very passionate about her subject and knows a lot! For this class, it was very important to attend lecture,  because without it, you'd fail the exams. Frankly, she was a very tough grader-too tough for a GEC class on E. European history. If you attend lecture AND read the books (which I didn't) getting an A isn't hard.

Extremely tough grader, it makes you feel like you're in an English class. Do not expect to get high grades on her papers. This said she was one of my favorites, she knows her stuff and is passionate. Class can be long sometimes though.

I absolutely loved this class. It wasn't easy, but it was really interesting. She really knows her stuff and she is very passionate about Russia's history. She is a very hard grader with really high expectations, but she is  more than willing to help if you approach her with questions. I would highly recommend her.

I felt like I wrote some of my best papers for this class, but didn't get higher than a C on any of them. She is a very, very tough grader, but an interesting professor, and I'm sure she would explain anything you wanted her to.

She speaks very slowly which sometimes makes it very hard to understand what she is saying but she knows the topics very well and thoroughly goes into what the textbook deals with, which facilitates everything because there is really no need to read the textbook. She is an extremely tough grader.

If you take this class you better be good at teaching yourself. She's nice enough but definitely not helpful at all and she talks sssllllooowwwww. If it weren't for the subject this class would be AWFUL. She also grades very hard and is not remotely helpful. I wish I would have read about these review before taking the class. I Wouldn't have.

She's not a bad teacher, she just wholeheartedly believes that only one or two students deserve an A- and that no one ought to get an A. Her expectations rise exponentially from paper to paper, but doesn't get any better at explaining the material or providing concrete examples. It's a good class, but a really tough ride.

This professor was very passionate about what she was teaching and was very helpful. I really enjoyed taking this class and feel as though I learned a lot. You'd be lucky to have her as a professor! She's the best!

Although very informed on what she was teaching, she was horrible at getting it across to the students. her lectures were so boring i found it hard to even stay awake, let alone pay attention. her grading is absolutely ridiculously strict for no reason. she makes it clear whether she likes you or not and your grade will be based off that.

class was pointless. dont do the online readings it only applies to the final paper which is 2 prompts based off our readings. dont go to class at all. in projects make sure you have one powerpoint. and you watch time. the papers are extremely basic and easy. getting a B+/A- wont be hard at all. if anything it was a huge waste of 148mins.

Very uninteresting. She mainly just lectures about statistics and does not show many examples in a monotone voice.The only thing cool about the class is the books we read: Gommorah, The Natashas, and Mcmafia. You have a presentation with a few other classmates on a topic that interests you.

She is a very tough grader and you have to get used to her style of teaching. If you are not super interested in the subject you will be bored. Her exams and paper are difficult so plan ahead. I did feel at times that if you did not give a "phd" worthy answer than she didn't give you a good score.

She is worthless as a teacher. This class had a lot of potential but she killed all of it. Lack of content was astounding. My baby sister knows more about European crime. Lecture is deathly boring! Opinions contrary to hers are not welcomed at all. Those who disagree are punished in grades. This is a class for mindless drones only. Beware!

I had her for 2 classes this quarter and this was the worse of the two.  She had no clear lesson plan and it was hard to pay attention.  It seemed like her expectations of the papers seemed to change when she graded it.  She assigned way too many books for each class.  Overall I would never take another class taught by her.

The class is pretty intense.  There are 3 textbooks assigned.  I only read them for the papers.  Make sure to go to every class because many times she discusses exactly what she expects to be written in papers and on exams.  She is a tough grader, but as long as you take good notes in class you should be fine.

Way too much reading for a 200 level class. You really can't skip. It's a good idea to put specific details in your essays if you want a good grade. I got an A in this class but I studied so much for the exams it was ridiculous. It made me interested in Eastern Europe though.

Incredibly boring lectures, harsh grader almost to an extreme. Assigned textbooks are awful. Yes, she knows what she's talking about, but she rarely has anything interesting to say. Would avoid any more classes that she taught, wouldn't recommend her at all.

Not too bad of a class as long as you come to class.  I didn't open my text books except to write my papers.  They were extremely boring.  You really really need to study for the tests though.  And I think this class should be higher than a 200-level course.  She expects a lot.

This is an excellent class. The professor really knows her subject. Her lectures are clear and easy to understand. You are required to put forth effort to obtain a good grade but that's really not unreasonable for a college class. She is more than willing to take time to answer questions but does not allow students to dominate the lecture.
She is a really tough grader!  Lectures are considerably long and boring.  The tests are essay and really difficult.  The books assigned (3) are terrible to read and a waste of money.
No Comments

Great course. She doesnt grade as hard as others will have you think. She expects you to be competent, and if you arent, she'll stick it to you. I like her straightforward style and she definetely knows what she is talking about.

Very very tough grader, almost to a laughable extent. The book from Marples is too long, don't even bother buying/reading it. Her lectures are ok, she knows a lot about the subject, but can become boring over time. Doesn't seem very approachable.

Horrible Teacher, I missed 1 class for a doctors appointment and she wouldn't even tell me what we'd done in class that day.  Ridiculous grader, and rescheduled our exam to 1 week early with almost no notice.  I will go out of my way to never take a class with her again.
Horrible teacher, lectures for two hours straight, grades hard.. gives lots of information, so its hard to know what you need for the tests...boring..
Lectures are interesting, but attending does not ensure a good grade.  I read and didn't miss a class and am praying for a C.  She is an *extremely* difficult grader.

She's an excellent teacher. There is a lot of assigned reading (3 books) but you only really have to read one (book report) if you attend all of her classes. All of the material on the tests are from lecture so skipping is not a good idea. She's a tough grader but if you attend class and take good notes you shouldn't have any problems.

She is a really interesting person and tells good stories but she is also an extremely tough grader. You don't need to read the books if you go to all the lectures and take notes, but know specific details for tests.

There's nothing from this class that i couldn't have learned from the book. She is extremely stubborn, so don't ever disagree with her. your grade will suffer- on our midterm only 3/54 people got above a 90 percent.

The class itself is pretty interesting and she does give a lot of facts and things that help give you an idea of what life was really like in the USSR...however, when she grades she is kind of harsh--she looks for very particular things when grading.  If you want an A you better learn exactly what that thing is.  Otherwise, good course.

She does not accept any challenging opinions, even if they do have merit. Just because she is from Bulgaria, doesn't mean she grew up in the USSR; thus, I think that many of her opinions are formed by the books she's read and not from actual experience. So in my mind, it's not right to discount the life experiences of those who have  lived there.
she made me interested in Eastern Europe!

AWESOME CLASS!  She really knows what she is talking about.  Often throws in bits of trivia and knowledge one would not normally think about.  Highly suggest the class!  Exams are fine as long as you study and write plenty to explain your answers.

She really knows what she's talking about and is easy to understand.  Her knowledge is seemingly endless, which makes lectures fairly interesting.  The exams were tough, but not impossible if you attend lecture, take thorough notes, and keep up with studying.

She is probably one of the most unrealistic graders on campus.  Really, give her exactly and more than what she wants out of you in an essay and you'll be lucky to pull off a C.  If possible, don't take any classes from her.  Terrible, boring, and strict.  Overall just a bad proffesor.

I'd have to say that it is true, disagreeing with her is fruitless.  Anyways, the course is difficult, but stimulating if you're up for a challenge. There is a lot of reading as well (3 books). If you take this class be sure to take notes and pay attention. Missing class a lot isn't a good idea.

Great professor, knows her stuff. Comes from the region, very wise in communist policies. She's tough, but it's well worth it. Make sure you read the small, white book and take a lot of notes, should prepare you for the exams the best
Pretty tough grading, good teacher though. Lots of reading, sometimes to real excess for a 200 level class.
Intelligent, good lectures.  Don't ever disagree with her, though, or your grade will suffer - even if you're simply voicing an opinion.

Very good teacher.  You can understand her and where she's coming from.  Make sure to do reading assignments and check with syllabus.  Just because she doesn't go over it in class, doesn't mean its off-limits.  I got a B- with a good amount of work
She gives great lectures - very entertaining and fun to listen to, but she grades very very hard.  Coming to class and reading the text aren't enough to do well in her class.

summary_comment: Professor Stratman is highly regarded for making his classes engaging and enjoyable, with a focus on interactive lectures and interesting discussions. He is known for being approachable, knowledgeable, and humorous, and while the material requires engagement and preparation, particularly through the required textbooks, his teaching style and fair grading policy contribute to a positive learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Stratman is highly regarded for making his classes engaging and easy, with a focus on interactive lectures, interesting discussions, and accessible quizzes. He is known for being approachable, knowledgeable, and humorous, though students emphasize the importance of purchasing the textbook for consistent success.

Ratings.comment: He is a great prof and made this class a lot fun and easy. There is decision posts and quizzes online.

BUY THE BOOK! Questions on quizzes are literally taken word-for-word. You will NOT PASS if you do not have the book. Prof Stratman is very knowledgeable in his field and a nice guy. No papers for this class, just Carmen quizzes, discussions, and two exams. None are hard, but make sure you budget enough time.

Professor Stratman is very chill and an easy grader. All quizzes and exams are open book and very easy if you have the e-book. Interesting discussion board content and lots of different topics/current events discussed in lectures.
He is just absolutely amazing, he interacts with his students, is understanding, and he is hilarious.

Professor Stratman is an absolute G, he was my favorite professor from my entire college experience. I had him for homeland security and terror & terrorism. He is funny, approachable and highly knowledgeable about the course content. I recommend buying the textbooks online.

I was so fair out of my league taking this class I don't know what I was thinking. However Mr. Stratman worked with me before class and I got an A. I suggest buying the online book vs actual book. I highly recommend him and I hope to take all of his classes. However this not a "easy A" you do have to show up and do the readings.

This was a really fun class! Prof Stratman is extremely knowledgable and his lectures were informative and hilarious. Weekly quizzes are open-note. The class relies heavily on the textbooks, but they're relatively cheap. I think this was a really great way to learn about something new without risking your GPA!

One of the best international studies professors at Ohio State. I learned so many things during his lectures and enjoyed showing up to class. Make sure you have the textbooks. Only three things are not open book, and they are easy memorization. Will definitely be taking him again, so lucky to be able to have him.
His Homeland Security class was easier than his terror and terrorism class, but both should be VERY easy A's!
Really great, get the ebook and its super easy.

This class appears to be a step up from his other classes. You must read the book for his weekly quizzes, which are a good chunk of your grade. The exams are open-book, but you actually need to read before the day of. His papers aren't difficult, but you need to put effort into them. Very funny guy with great stories, so show up to class!

Frank is very well respected and a great professor. He doesn't kill you with unnecessary homework and readings. I actually learned a lot in this class that was applicable to real life, and I genuinely enjoyed the class. Frank is HILARIOUS and is always making the class crack up. Also, he is attractive which is a bonus. 10/10 would take him again.

The best stories ever. He has crazy relevant experience and will share that with you. If you don't come to class get ready for some "heart burn" because attendance is mandatory. But you'll want to come to class because it is so interesting. He'll accommodate you if necessary and is super accessible. 10/10 would take again.

Very accessible, great textbooks, great conversations, great lectures, great stories. Genuinely cares about the success of his students. Must take him. Best professor at Ohio State. You won't be disappointed. Show up, take interest, and you'll do great! No heartburn at all with him.
The absolute best. 10/10 would recommend. He has the real world experience that makes his lectures engaging. He has all the war stories you could ever want. Buy the books and you'll pass.

My 3rd class with him. Frank Stratman is the best instructor that I've had at Ohio State. His lectures are always relevant, easy to follow, and very enriching. You're expected to come to class, and be prepared to participate in discussions that pertain to the course material. No long nonsensical papers. Take his classes! Learn a lot & GPA booster.

Frank Stratman was awesome. I really enjoyed his class. I learned a lot but without the stress. Easy online quizzes, open book tests, and a few easy short papers. Truly wants his students to do well, learn, and think for themselves. One of the best profs at OSU.

Stratman is amazing! He has real world experience and a sense of humor that makes classes engaging. Unlike other classes, you are not overflooded with information that you will never use again, the subject and the way he presents it is applicable and useful. I am taking another class with him asap.

Intro to Homeland Security was an easy and interesting class. Online quizzes can be taken as many times as you want, tests are open textbook and there's one group project. Lectures are interesting and relevant to current events. I plan on taking Mr. Stratman's Terror class in the fall.
Open book midterm/final makes it super easy, very interesting lectures and you learn a lot
Highly Recommended ... Great Professor ... Very respectful. Always go for his classes

Professor Startman is one of the best professors I ever had. Very helpful, understanding, knowledgeable, respectful. Syllabus is very clear and very organized. Professor was very passionate about the materials. I would definitely take any of his classes and recommend his classes to my friends too. I benefited  a lot of this class and enjoyed every
Very fair and helpful. Assignments were very easy and it was easy to get a 100 on exams as well.
Flexible and understanding. Easy to get along with and very helpful.
Professor Stratman is one of the best professors I have ever had. Respectful, Hilarious. Great Class. Clear materials. Gives feedback and willing to help. Would definitely take any of his classes.

summary_comment: Professor Jiang is highly regarded for her dedication to her subject matter and her students. Her teaching approach is primarily lecture-based with substantial homework assignments that are manageable. She successfully facilitated a unique semester-long group presentation project with international students, enhancing the learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Jiang is highly regarded for her dedication to her subject matter and engaging teaching style. Her course includes a significant group presentation with international students, though it is lecture-intensive with manageable homework assignments.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Jiang is an amazing professor. She cares about what she is teaching. The main assignment for this class is a group presentation done with students at a university in Mexico which was interesting to navigate. It was done over the course of the entire semester. Pretty lecture-heavy and there is a decent amount of hw but completely doable.

SEI.Subject: FRIT
SEI.Class Name: The 21st-Century Skill: Intercultural Competence for Global Citizenship

summary_comment: Professor Bussell is highly regarded for her dedication to her students and her teaching quality, with many recommending her classes. While some assignments can be lengthy, particularly later in the semester, her supportive approach and generous extra credit opportunities make achieving a high grade feasible. Students appreciate her engagement with class discussions and her overall positive influence on the learning environment.
summary_comment_short: Professor Bussell is highly regarded for her dedication to her students and her teaching quality, though some assignments can be lengthy. She encourages active participation and offers ample opportunities for extra credit, making it easier to achieve high grades.

Ratings.comment: I would take more classes w her if I could. She rlly cares abt her students and overall is a good teacher. Some assignments are rlly long but as long as ur paying attention to deadlines, you'll be fine. She gives plenty of extra credit so it's easier than u think to get a high A in this class. I would recommend taking it, even if you don't need it.

A nice teacher that really appreciates students being active and participating in class discussions. A couple of assignments throughout the semester, but more of them are due towards the second half. I would take her class again.

summary_comment: Professor Payne is known for his engaging and discussion-based teaching style, which many students find enjoyable and easy. He prioritizes participation over grades and is perceived as understanding and supportive of students' personal circumstances. However, some students have criticized his lack of timely grading, suggesting a need for greater accountability in this area.
summary_comment_short: Professor Payne is known for his engaging and discussion-based teaching style, which many students find enjoyable and easy, leading to high satisfaction rates. However, some students have criticized his lack of prompt grading and perceived lack of commitment, noting that he sometimes delays putting in grades until late in the semester.

Ratings.comment: This class is super easy! It is all discussion-based, which made the class interested, and I genuinely enjoyed going to class. Jason cares more about participation than actual grades, which I really liked! Highly recommend!

Jason is more interested in teaching/learning than grading. His classes cultivate interesting discussions that lead everyone (students and teacher included) to draw insights from the course materials and from each other. He's very understanding of students with unique or complicated lives outside of class. One of the better teachers I ever had.

Although the class content was interesting and Jason allows us to lead the class with our own discussion, his lack of commitment does not deserve over a 2/5. We are now 3 weeks from the end of the semester and he still has not put in any grades. None of us know how we will end up in the class because he is too lazy to put in 5 grades.

This class was a really easy A, and this is coming from someone who doesn't like science fiction. As long as you go to class most of the time and read parts of every book, you should be good to go. I would definitely take this class again.
Just participate in class, think about the material and this is a great class

Jason was really an awesome professor. He is truly funny and cared about what he taught and made the class fun. He encourages talking and participation and makes you feel respected no matter your opinion. We had a few reflection papers and a midterm and final. Very easy, very interesting, I highly recommend.

So funny and caring. Loved the topics that we covered and Jason was really nice and didn't really care about grades. As long as you do the papers and show up and participate you are guaranteed a good grade. Would definitely take again!

such an intriguing man and class. easy A if you show up and involve yourself in discussion. He makes learning fun and I wish all teachers were as good as him when it comes to relating with the class and making us feel comfortable and inspired.
Really interesting discussions, would definitely take again. A great and super easy class. Three response papers (2 pgs), one midterm and a final - all typed at home.
Easy A!

Jason is a wonderful teacher, he chooses short, interesting novels so students will actually read them. He's very laid back, and just enjoys having thoughtful discussions about the books, we even watched movies! He won't ever just call on you and make you talk. Fair and easy grader on the papers! Take Jason's class if you can! Coolest teacher ever.

Despite being skeptical during the first few weeks, I really enjoyed this class. The class was based off of reading we did for homework, but we essentially always ended up discussing relevant current events and I found it very interesting. Jason encouraged us to disagree and discuss our viewpoints in a respectful way and I feel I gained a lot.

Jason was so laid back and funny.  He really didn't care about grades at all, he just wanted us to learn and discuss relevant topics.  The class was almost no work, and we only ended up writing 1 real paper.  He really cared about his students and wanted us to think for ourselves.  I would definitely take another class with him.

Jason is one of my favorite instructors! Started off having weekly quizzes but that didn't last long. 3 short response papers and a midterm and final paper. Talk in class for participation! We read for class and discussed it. Most of the class was just kids sharing their opinions on relevant topics in culture today. Very funny and cares a lot!

Really entertaining topics that he presents in a fun way. Most work done was to read a few short books and write papers. Funny guy that could give you a new perspective on just about anything. I would take any of his classes

He made a GE lit course enjoyable! Jason cares about his students and wants people to do well. The books were interesting and we discussed them thoroughly in class. He's very reachable and willing to help.

I've taken two courses with Jason, he's an inspirational professor who truly cares about learning and becoming a more intellectual and worldly student. The reading assignments are interesting and never too demanding. He's very laid-back and has almost no filter, which is very entertaining. I would definitely recommend him!!! Best prof I've had here

Funny guy. It seemed like grades were not important to him--discussing the material was, which was nice. If you really like film and literature, this is your class, because the discussions are interesting.

Jason is an awesome teacher and a really cool person.  His class is not difficult, the books you read are easy and usually enjoyable, and he works to make the discussions fun.  On top of that, he really reaches out to students and is always welcoming of conversations afteroutside of class
Very easy course. As long as you show up every class and participate!

Honest to God, the best professor I have ever had a class with. Shows up to almost every class wearing basketball shorts and even Grateful Dead t-shirts but the class is a semester long discussion on a great article. The readings are light and extremely interesting; wants you to do well in his class. Extremely helpful and easy to talk to

He is a great professor, take him. He takes very long to grade assignments, but he really cares about his students and their thoughts on how class is going. For this film class, the films were okay not very good, but having him discuss them is great. Papers were not bad at all, easy class. Relaxed feel, great guy! Speak in class and you'll get an A

We graded our own participation and quizzes. Attendance mandatory but he doesn't really pay attention. Papers are single spaced, watch out for that. An A is attainable, but it will be a boring and annoying one. He takes forever to grade work, if at all.

Seriously such a great professor. A professor who wants his class to think for themselves. Class was all discussions, no notes. He is honestly my favorite professor of all time. I wish all professors could be like him, and college would be 1000000x better. Truly a GREAT man
Class is fairly relaxed. Mostly just sharing ideas on topics assigned for reading. Wide variety of books assigned throughout the semester. Papers not graded until much after they're turned in.

If you can possibly have him as a teacher, do it. Makes class enjoyable and you just get to relax and talk. Every class he just sat in fron of the room and we just casually talked about the books. Great teacher.
Best teacher I've had at OSU so far. Wants us to develop our own opinions rather than jam his thoughts down students throats (Like several other professors). Take his class!

This is the first time I have ever posted on this website, but I have never had a teacher like Jason Payne. This is a man who is committed not only to teaching young adults, but to helping them develop. His class discussion are thoughtful and riveting. The reading materials are interesting, and the assignments are reasonable. Take his classes!!

He's one of the most interesting profs I've had at OSU. Easy grader, but gave really thoughtful feedback on drafts. He is really committed to the process of teaching as well. All the material he gives is very easy to read but still good for opening discussion. Would recommend taking a class he is teaching.

I thoroughly enjoyed Jason Payne. He leads great class discussions, and doesn't let anyone say the obvious answer then lapse back into silence. There was lots of reading and the midterm made me want to pull my hair out, but he's an easy grader and mostly just wants a thoughtful response. I would highly recommend him.
Jason did not hand back any graded work, but his opinions were very interesting and lead class discussions well. Just participate in class and you will get an A.
Jason Payne was a great teacher, he was very easy going and the workload was light.  I recommend taking his classes
loved the books he assigned

Discussions were great. But reading the entire book was never necessary. As long as you had a clue what the book was about you can jump into the conversation which always takes many twists and turns and still get participation points. Late to class, late grading papers, very opinionated and quick to put down other's views.

Jason is very relaxed and easy-going. The class is based on discussion and reading. I liked all the books we read and movies we watched in class. He canceled class a few times, and was late handing things back, but he's willing to work with you if you have issues. I love this teaching style and enjoyed the discussions and the class.

jason is an atypical instructor to say the least. his demeanor is very relaxed (expect a lot of big dogs apparel and not a single tie--which i'm not knocking). there was a lot of reading, but it is very relevant. his discussions are great, and he knows the ins and outs of a lot of issues. he's lax about deadlines, which i like but isn't for all.

FILM STUDIES PEOPLE BEWARE: such a disappointment.  seems like a nice guy but i have never had a prof with more excuses.  cancelled class multiple times, cancelled a midterm and two papers.  maybe some people like that, but i don't like living in grade purgatory.  flirted an uncomfortable amount and chose creepy art films and racy novels.

Late, late, late. Late to class, late for grading, late for posting final grades. It's Saturday and I still have NO idea how I did in the class. His lectures were extremely interesting and the books/films he chose were fantastic, but I literally did not receive a single paper back until the last week of class.

Very good class and instructor. The best discussion leader of all times. Very helpful, intelligent, and open minded. Pretty funny and laid back. Plays devils advocate but not too much to where it is annoying. Expects you to read but he picks worthwhile books.

This was my favorite class of the quarter. He does play devil's advocate, but I liked it, it made me think about the other perspective. Class discussions are important, so do the reading. Books are interesting, doesn't grade too harshly. I highly recommend taking this class!!

I really enjoyed this class.  great class discussions and worthwhile reading.  He does like to play devils advocate but respects everyones opinion.It is necessary to reaad the books to partispate but pays off.  I feel like i really learned a lot from this class and highly recomended it to my friends.

Plays the devil advocate constantly.  Don't expect him to simply agree with you when you talk in class.  But, this challenges you to see the other side of your opinions.  You must be an in class talker!!!  I enjoyed the class overall.  No busy work.

This guy is a total joke.  Unprofesional, ungly, unorganized and totally irrelevent.  He assigns around 7 or so books and expects the students to read them all.  If you want to be embarrased for your university and sit through this joke of a course, take Jason Payne.
No Comments

Recommended.  Class discussions were interesting and worthwhile. Assignments were super easy if you did the reading, which was also interesting and worthwhile.  I thought he graded very easily on the two main papers. He's easy to work with if you have a problem, too.
Wears a Big Dog hoodie and pajama pants to class on multiple occasions. Hilarious class, very easy. Loves discussion and keeps things interesting. Makes you think. I'd highly recommend him.
good teacher

Uncomfortable how much he flirts with students,  however, probably one of the easiest teachers.  Don't have to think too hard about any assignments, don't even really have to do the reading.  Come to class and try to say one thing to participate.  We were dismissed early every day.  He likes discussion more than assignments.  Course load is cake.

surprisingly unprofessional all around; not very challenging, not punctual with grades, he kinda flirts a little with the females; somewhat interesting, but also of no real use; ultimately disappointed
This was a very interesting class, and Jason was a very fair teacher. This class requires a substantial amount of reading. But the reading material is interesting.
No Comments
Liked him.

Jason Was a GREAT teacher! I am soon to be a junior and he was my favorite professor ever! The class was not your typical learn how to write and be bored the whole class. I had it at 7:30 2 days a week and really never got bored. He discusses the books a lot and finds it more important to have interesting discussions than following a strict syllabu

Dont take this class if you dont like to read because you have to do a lot of it.  Class is spent doing group discussion.  He is knowledgable, but this was a writing class and he never mentioned a word about how to write a paper.
His class was very interesting and he showed interest in the material he brought to class, which always helps.
No Comments

Possibly the dumbest professor on campus. Unorganized, gives preferential treatment to particular students, and just makes the entire class unpleasant. The class isn't too difficult though. Tons of books, but even if you do not read any of them you will make out with a B or C at worst.

Jason was a GREAT teacher... extremely helpful, and very interesting.  if you dont like reading, dont take this class, but the books are easy and fun, and his classes are all talking about the books. very fun and approachable!!

summary_comment: Professor Hightower is known for running his classes smoothly, particularly in remote settings, and is generally accessible to students. However, some find his instructions unclear and his final grades are often submitted late. Despite these issues, he is considered a good professor, especially during challenging times like the pandemic.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hightower demonstrated strong classroom management skills, ensuring smooth operations in a remote setting. However, his instructions were occasionally unclear, and he delayed final grades until nearly the end of the semester.

Ratings.comment: I had Dr. Hightower in a remote class and he made the class run by smoothly, he didn't check the chat a lot though. I felt like he was pretty accessible but sometimes his instructions were unclear, however, he's still a good professor to have especially during a pandemic. Oh, but he left final grades until the day before the end of the semester.

Rudy is incredible! I genuinely loved going to his class. His grading is fair, and the workload for the class is manageable. Rudy includes a lot of case studies and simulations in his class, which helps a lot if you are someone who learns through applied practice. He also genuinely shows he cares about engaging with students in the classroom.
