summary_comment: Professor Winn offers an easy class with minimal homework and a focus on his extensive life experiences, making the content engaging and memorable. Students appreciate his approachable nature and the practical insights he provides, though some find the lectures can be dry at times. The grading is relatively lenient, with mandatory attendance and open-note exams contributing to the ease of earning an A.
summary_comment_short: Professor Winn offers an easy class with minimal homework and a focus on engaging storytelling based on his extensive career experiences. His teaching style is highly regarded for making the content interesting and accessible, though some find the lectures can be dry at times.

Ratings.comment: Professor Winn's class is very easy as long as you show up. I barely ever took notes and just listened to his stories and I got the easiest A ever. No homework and like two tests. He has insane stories from his career and it is super fun to hear about them all. You can tell this guy has done it all.

IMO professor Winn is my favorite professor ever at osu. He is the sweetest man ever and just so nice. He wants you to pass and has super interesting content and stories since hes had a ton of different job experiences, one of them working for DHS. Please take this class. He will not disappoint!

Professor Winn is extremely knowledgeable, & bases his lectures on slides that are on the Carmen page. He relates the lectures to his life experiences which makes the class much more interesting! His exams are very reasonable, & he believes that it's better to give you the resources & have you know where to find an answer than just memorizing it.

Mandatory attendance, open note/laptop quizzes (all the information needed is uploaded and accessible on Carmen). Go to class, listen to what he has to say and it is an easy A. Prof Winn is extremely knowledgable about Homeland Security. This class is worth taking, you will learn a lot about the country and its defense system.

Very easy class. Tests are open note/computer and the only other grades come from FEMA certifications, a participation grade for a group presentation, and class participation. Dr. Winn teaches his life experiences more than the actual material, but has a lot of good connections. Easy A, but don't expect to learn much.

Very nice guy. Lectures can be dry and drawn out at times, but he is very knowledgeable in field of Homeland Security. No textbook, no readings. Tells lots of personal stories. Grade consists of midterm, final, attendance, FEMA certifications, and group project. Overall easy A, learned a lot.
Good real world knowledge, full of information on the topic.  Brings in guest speakers to elaborate on certain careers.  Very easy class.

I learned a lot, but his lectures are dry at times. He just talks all over the place, but seriously the easiest class I have taken. If you don't come to class your grade will drop, so show up. He takes attendance. Midterm was easy, can use notes and computer but still prepare. No book, no readings. Great guy to get to know and use as a reference.

Prof Winn is awesome! Easiest class I've ever taken. He takes attendance so you have to go to every class, but if you do, you'll get an easy A. Both exams you can use your computer and theres extra credit. He's a really nice man and is extremely knowledgeable about Homeland Security. Show up A. And theres no textbook! And no readings. Ever.

He takes attendance each day, make sure you're there. His lectures are essentially stories from his long career in Homeland Security. VERY interesting man. Not a difficult class: Show up, listen, and you'll be fine. You can use notes and your computer during the exams because in the real world, "You need to know WHERE to find the info you need".
He's an old geezer full of politics! Doesn't know how to use computer.

Probably the easiest 3 credit hours you could ever earn. You can use your notes and computer mid-term and final. In addition to that he puts 10 extra bonus points on the exams. The class overall though was quite interesting. Mr. Winn loves what he does and is very knowledgeable about Homeland Security. I would definitely take this class again.

summary_comment: Professor Leonard is highly regarded for his genuine engagement with both the material and his students, making him a valuable resource for CRPLAN majors and minors. His lectures are engaging and lecture-heavy, though some find them dense and the lack of provided readings can be challenging. The class structure emphasizes participation and a group presentation, with exams that are time-pressured but graded fairly.
summary_comment_short: Professor Leonard is highly regarded for his genuine interest in the subject matter and his students, though his classes are largely lecture-based with limited interaction outside of mandatory group presentations and exams. The class structure can be challenging due to its heavy reliance on attendance and participation, and some students find the material and assessments demanding despite the professor's approachable nature.

Ratings.comment: Great guy with a genuine investment in material and students.

Mandatory for CRPLAN majors/minors. 1/2 lecture 1/2 recitation. Readings are assigned, but they're never provided and they're never important. Some group work components. TAs grade in silence and obscurity. Hard to reach professors or TAs outside class. It is not taken seriously by either the professor(s) or students, fwiw.

Lecture-heavy, but lectures are engaging. The course is graded on participation/attendance, 3 exams, and a group presentation. Exams are a time crunch but graded fairly. Some readings are dense and he expects you to have them read for discussions each week. He cares about the subject matter and provides a fair view of neoliberalism/globalization.
So nice, interesting lecturer. Very personable and makes everyone feel respected.

Honestly, very very nice professor. His lectures felt like I learned nothing, yet learned a lot. There aren't any exams, just lots of papers. It is an easy A, and he's very understanding to issues outside of class.

Dr. Leonard is laid back and offers genuine lecture material that is applicable. This class is basically completion grades, and you get to play Cities Skylines. He focuses on the importance of reflection and articulation.
Prof. Leonard is a great lecturer, he has that charm. The content of CRP 2110 is interesting and the lab activities are fun and informative
Good prof, bad class. Intro class was poorly organized and had too many moving pieces. Also way way way to much emphasis put on playing a dang computer game.

Dr Leonard is one of the very best teachers I've had at Ohio State. He listens and adjusts his lectures to the discussion of the students. He brought out the very best in the entire class and it was a privilege to learn from him. Compassionate and obviously learned.

Not recommended. There is no clear grading criteria for assignments (all of which are graded by an illusive TA). There are papers due once a week over readings that are incredibly long and in depth. You should take a few econ courses before attempting this! There are also lots of group projects.

5 Pop quizzes for attendance. Amazing teacher with his personal research. I learned so much. He assigned multiple books. He is new to OSU in 2017. Amazing lectures. Some movie days. All relevant to creating a flowing historical story. Best class ive ever taken in terms of understanding the modern food system. Harsh test grader tho so do the reading

summary_comment: Professor El-Sherbini is perceived as unorganized and unclear in her teaching approach, leading to confusion among students regarding assignment requirements and deadlines. Students found the class structure chaotic, with varying syllabi and rubrics causing frustration. Overall, the feedback indicates a lack of substantive learning outcomes and a highly disorganized classroom environment.
summary_comment_short: Professor El-Sherbini is perceived as unorganized and unclear in her teaching approach, leading to confusion and frustration among students regarding assignment requirements and deadlines. Students report that they did not gain any practical knowledge from the course and found it to be poorly structured with an overemphasis on presentations without substantive instruction.

Ratings.comment: Although I could tell Magda is kind and wanted us all to learn, she was very unorganized and unclear about requirements and dates for assignments. We received different syllabi and different rubrics for the same assignments which was confusing and frustrating. I didn't learn anything I can use in the future.

This is the worst class I have ever taken. Professor El-Sherbini was terribly unorganized. I didn't learn anything and I never knew what was going on. We did presentations every single day and she never taught anything.

summary_comment: Professor Hwang is known for his lecture-heavy teaching style, which can make classes challenging to stay engaged in without thorough note-taking. Despite some students finding his approach dry and difficult to stay focused during, many appreciate his depth of knowledge and passion for the subject matter, noting that attendance is not strictly enforced. Overall, while his exams are manageable with attention, some students suggest there might be better options for general education requirements.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hwang is known for his lecture-heavy teaching style, which can make classes challenging to stay engaged in without active note-taking. Despite some students finding his classes difficult and lectures unengaging, many appreciate his depth of knowledge and willingness to help outside of class, though his exams are manageable with attentive study.

Ratings.comment: Extremely lecture heavy its pretty much the entire course so take good notes because powerpoints dont help. I fell asleep many times in class. Had required readings although I never did them and I passed. Exams are manageable if you pay attention well enough but if youre taking this for a GE, theres probably a better option.

He does not allow students to use tech at all, yet he uses his use of technology as a power move. He thinks it's a good analogy for his course materials. He only wants you to agree with how he teaches materials. Every class you miss is 3% off your grade. Most difficult professor I have dealt with when it comes to students with mental illness.

Dr. Hwang was a great professor. A little lecture heavy but the material is very interesting. The final paper topic is your choice and he is always open to meet outside of class if you have questions or want to discuss your paper proposal. If he taught other classes I would definitely take them.

Go to his review sessions and ask questions about the study guide and generally you will do well if you review the powerpoints afterwards. He likes to write things on the board, so I highly recommend sitting where you can see the words. Many people just bs his class and don't pay attention to lecture.

Dr. Hwang is pretty freaking amazing. He's got a great sense of humor and is passionate about his teachings. And he'll give you short readings to get to on your own time. He's a fair grader. I swear to God, if you come to class, take a few notes, and read the required readings, you'll leave this class with a %100. Too easy.

Dr. Hwang is a highly informative and you will learn a lot from him. However, his lectures are rather long and dry, which makes it hard to stay focused the whole class. Attendance is not necessary at all. He is very helpful and always willing to talk to students after class. Graded on 2 exams and 1 big paper project

Prof. Hwang was an interesting lecturer with a deep background in his course material. He was exceedingly knowledgeable in the topics he taught, and he provided a large array of supplementary readings for further coherency. His lectures always surprised and interested me, and the exams were not as difficult as I expected. Made me love history!

Really great professor. Loved his approach - he presented theories in order to get us thinking and develop our own views. Taught history as it should be - presented clear-cut facts BEFORE going on to interpretation, so it was nice to see no revisionist history sap. Grading was a bit stringent, but the knowledge gained was definitely worth it.

Professor Hwang is definitely a nice guy, although his lectures are pretty confusing. Take good notes and this class shouldn't be too hard to pass.  There are no long papers (or papers at all), but he does give out pop quizzes, which he sometimes warns you about the class before. My main tip would be to know the Chinese characters!!

Professor Hwang is a delightful lecturer. He's a tad overly fond of metaphors for structuring his points and he is rather too lenient of a graderdoesn't write challenging enough exams. But while this was only an intro course, the scopestructure of it was excellent and his knowledge and approach to the relevant topics was wonderful! Great class!

I took this class just for an extra Gen Ed.  I regret it because now i have a W from withdrawing from this class.  Very long readings.  The lectures are incredibly boring and they just don't make sense.  He uses examples but when it came to the midterm it was nothing like what he had talked about.

I read a few comments (about how this prof gets off topic) here before enrolling, thinkin that I'd get over it bc I'm a korean student too like him. Turns out that I have NO IDEA what hehis ppts trying to say- he hardly talks about the course materials. Recommended readings suddenly become required right before the exam. Never. Take. Him. Ever.

There are 3 pop quizzes, 2 extra credit assignments so your grade depends on the midterms. They were pretty tough if you didn't attend his lectures or study with the study guide. The lectures are boring and sit towards the front because he writes on the board. As long as you attend the lectures and read the supplemental readings, you should be fine

Pretty easy class. He gets off topic really easily, but makes great comparisons to different topics. Test were pretty easy, you just have to do the required readings and fill in the blanks. Pretty interesting teacher

Amazing class and an amazing teacher. A lot of comments on this site say that he was terrible, but they are all for his intro class. I took all 3 of his classes, and felt that he was a very informative and as long as you're not an idiot he is easy to follow and you can learn a lot. He is entertaining and a pleasure to have as a teacher.

Although I did receive a lower grade than expected, he was a good professor. A little difficult to understand, but he knows what he's talking about and he makes topics relevant and interesting. Don't miss class and take notes and you'll be fine.
His lecture is sometime unclear because he is not a native speaker. but if you attend all classes, you can get a good grade easily. You don't need to read so much requirement readings.
Very unclear.  Jut rambles most of the time then you get tests with nothing he talked about on them.  Worst essay grading scheme ever.

Terrible teacher. Teaches his opinions and talks about nothing of relevance in class and his arguments have HUGE holes in them. Bashes on Gordon Gee any chance he gets. Grades "competitively" so you are based off of everyone in the class instead of your own work. Don't take this class. You will regret it.
So boring. Off topic. All-mixed-up Unclear lectures. A 5-6 page book review paper about 2 books(outside sources)
Hard to understand. Off topic. Biased. Good man, wished things were more clear though.

He's a nice guy and is intelligent, but his class is moreso a forum for his opinions than anything.  While I don't mind the fact he espouses views different than some of mine, I don't like the fact that he presents his views as fact and shoves them down people's throats. Not to mention, many of the views he presents have huge factual holes in them.

Avoid teacher if possible. Doesnt speak english very clearly. TEst and quizzes-you will have to basically memorize the reading because there will be an excerpt and you have to fill in the blank word. If you ask him for help-well there is no point. Notes are useless
Easiest teacher ever. All you have to do is go to class and take lecture notes. he doesn't have any tricky questions on both exams. great professor!

Hwang is an excellent teacher. His lectures may drone on about one subject/get off topic for a long time.  He clearly is teaching a lot of his opinion, which is fine. Don't get mad, and recognize that everyone is biased. Tests are a little confusing. I enjoyed the class a lot.
Best professor ever.  Waaaay better than most teachers at the school
makes no sense... my notes were a source of entertainment to my friends. would talk about moses... i went about 4 times and got a b+. waste of a class.

Four words: do not take him. He is so spacey and does not follow any kind of coherent notes. The quizes have weird quotation questions that are difficult. Take someone who like to engage students, rather than just rant to them.

Attendance is "mandatory", with loopholes.  If you can follow in class, you should do fine on exams, because they're structured so you really only have to know about one topic out of any he discussed.  All over the place with notes, and got off topic.  Kind of interesting, though.  Not what I expected.

Hwang is a nice guy, but his teaching skills are very below average. This is the type of person who would be great sitting in a reasearch lab and writing books on international studies but should not be lecturing and teaching students.

Professor Hwang knows his materials very well. He is an extremely intelligent man in regards toward international and domestic affairs. I truly enjoyed his classes. Students who are dissatisfied with his teachings tend to be ignorant or ethnocentric. I plan to take a class with him in the near future.

Hwang is a nice man. However, he barely lets anyone speak in his class and tends to drone on about things. His notes are not organized and it can be very frustrating to deal with. He is an easy grader, but its not worth it. Find someone else to take.
He was a good prof but he can be very hard to understand. Lectures are only 90 minutes but it seems like 3 hours. He is really boring.

Dr. Hwang is a very interesting and clearly intelligent person.  However he veers off topic constantly, uses rediculous metaphors to explain complex ideals and spends much of the class discussing irrelevant topics.  Do the readings and go to class, but prepare to be frustrated.
He is very long winded, does not let students voice their views and is very unclear. Avoid if you plan on learning something.

This is a really easy class,however, Hwang is at times very frustrating. His notes are terrible and there are so many arrows its hard to follow. 90 percent of what he says is "america is going down the drain". He also is extremely opinionated and doesn't let anyone participate. Extremely long winded, but easy A..if youre willing to put up with him

Great professor with VERY interesting views! He made lecture very great and encouraged participation. Questions came with great answers. Review sessions were very helpful. Even with the accent, he was easy to understand. I hope to take another class with him.

Well, I am a student from Korea, so there was absolutely no probelm for me understanding his accent. Beginning of the quarter, I had difficulties organizing my notes,,but after taking the first exam, I understood what he wanted. Hes a very nice guy and I really liked him as a person too. So Overall REALLY recommend him!!!!!

Very intelligent, knew the material extremely well.  Sometimes goes off subject a bit on rants.  But, if you come to class and take notes, you will do very well in his class.  Exams are very straightforward.
A little disorganized and hard to follow sometimes, but hes a good guy.  He also gives easy exams and even gave make-ups for his pop quizzes.  His accent is not bad at all.

Extremely intelligent, so it kind of gets in the way if you take an intro class like 201. If you actually know a bit about economics and political science before you take the class it's more interesting. he's funny and not a hard grader. However, chalkboard writing and notes are really confusing...lots of arrows...all over the place..

Poli Sci major here, class was informative, his accent is not really that bad. To me, his exams were a pain. They were a different format every time, very little room for error. It's true that he never stops talking, will go on even after the end of class while people are leaving.

Took this guys class a while ago but absolutely loved it! Wish he taught more upper level Poli Sci courses. The accent took a little while to get used to but wasn't too bad. Studying for first test was hard but once you figure out what he wants its not bad at all. Sorry to see so many others haven't liked him - he was one of my favorites!
I understood him but what he talked about and what was in the book were totally different! But I had fun!

Very difficult to understand. I am a poly sci major, so I typically enjoy anything political, but I dreaded coming to this class.  Handouts mean nothing without time spent in class.  Taking notes is a necessity (if you can understand him).  Tests are composed of several essays, normally verbatim from lectures.

Interesting, knowledgeable. I could understand him most of the time, I learned a lot about the history of global relations. He's looking for an interest in the material, your attention and an attempt to explain what you've learned in the exams and papers.
thick accent, never stops talking.  notes are hard to follow.  his handouts mean nothing to the untrained eye. tests relatively easy.  i fell asleep involuntarily.
No Comments

This guy is obviously very smart and well-informed.  Unfortunatley its hard to know what hes talking about most of the time because he has a heavy accent, a soft voice, and his handouts are extremely nonsensical.  I worked my ass off and came out with a B

He's a little hard to understand sometimes, but he can be very, very funny. The subject matter is a little dry also, but from time to time it can be fairly interesting. He's a good guy, but don't expect to participate much. He talks alot.
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Carlarne is highly regarded for his brilliance and passion for teaching, though his classes can be challenging due to extensive reading and weekly quizzes. His lectures are engaging, often supplemented with simulations and activities, and he is known for his thick British accent and sense of humor. Students appreciate his willingness to clarify assignments and provide additional support via email.
summary_comment_short: Professor Carlarne is highly regarded for his brilliance and passion for teaching, though his classes can be challenging due to extensive reading and weekly quizzes. Students appreciate his engaging and often humorous teaching style, despite some organizational issues and the need for expensive equipment.

Ratings.comment: I took both INTSTDS2800 and INTSTDS4802 taught by Dr. Carlarne. He is brilliant! 2800 requires an expensive handheld device to take the quizzes, if Carlarne knew about online options perhaps this could be replaced. 4802 is reading and writing heavy but will really prepare you for other upper level course work.

AGGRESSIVE BRITISH. Like so British, his accent, fashion, and mannerisms are so enjoyable. More seriously, he's very passionate about his course and has a very good understanding of what he's teaching so his explanations are good. In class, he requires you to buy a $60 handset to take his reading quizzes once a week, 3 of which he drops.

Funny guy and tries to get through lectures to get to activities. A big group project at the end of the semester, but you're assigned a group first week. I did a little over half of the readings (quizzes on most readings, not bad) and extra credit and was fine. He just wants you to get it. Sit towards the front, he mutters jokes under his breath.

He's a great guy. The class itself is pretty disorganized, but is not difficult. Quizzes in class over every reading that are relatively easy, and both the midterm and final are all multiple choice. Assigns group projects but really tries to make the class interesting. Good class overall.
Awesome guy. Thick British accent. Insanely brilliant. He does a lot of simulations in the class and quizzes are weekly.

Prof. Carlarne was one of the funniest professors I ever had.  Every class was a joy. He's a Brit who has tons of experience in the field of Peace Studies, and knows a lot of activists.  His lectures are straight forward and tests are memorization-based. There are group projects, but all of them are very simple.  Very helpful. Would take again.

This class was extremely interesting and Professor Carlarne aided with providing immense experience. Sometimes his assignment directions were a bit unclear and his explanations during class were of no help, but with a simple e-mail he would clarify. He keeps the class interesting and tries to confine lectures so we can do other activities.
Best professor I have ever had here at OSU.

Dr. Carlarne is one of the best professors anyone could ask for.  The class is a bit organized and altogether too easy to keep a student's interest throughout the entire semester, but the content and knowledge of Dr. Carlarne is fascinating.

summary_comment: Professor Hightower is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, making complex topics accessible and enjoyable. Students appreciate his availability and clear expectations for assignments, which helps them achieve high grades. His classes are described as interesting and rewarding, though some note that attending lectures is crucial for full understanding, as the textbook can be dry.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hightower is highly regarded for his engaging teaching style and ability to make complex topics interesting. Students consistently praise his clear expectations and supportive approach, though they note that active participation is key to success in his class.

Ratings.comment: Professor Rudy is a great teacher and super funny. The class had a fair amount of projects, but even though they were time consuming, they were interesting. Modeling data is fun! He is willing to meet with you if you need too! Ask him about his background because it is wild! You should attend class because the textbook, while helpful, is boring.
Great prof. I took the class online but had it been in person i would have learned more. He is a great professor though!
Dr. Hightower is awesome! He makes class interesting and is very specific as to what he expects on assignments. Listen to him, and you'll have no problem securing an A in his class.

Dr. Hightower was a great professor. The class isn't hard so long as you put in some effort. Make sure you read and come to class prepared as he loves to call randomly on students. Overall-would recommend!
Great guy and an incredibly interesting course!
Dr. Hightower is a great teacher and makes class interesting.

summary_comment: Professor Romero-Aguilar is widely regarded as a challenging and demanding instructor, with many students finding his lectures and assessments difficult to navigate. Several commenters noted his strict grading policies and lack of availability outside of class, while others described him as dismissive and unhelpful when students sought additional support. Overall, his teaching style appears to be highly polarizing, with some finding his approach too rigid and unaccommodating.
summary_comment_short: Professor Romero-Aguilar is widely regarded as a challenging and unhelpful instructor, with students citing his difficult grading, lack of availability after class, and insensitivity to students' needs as significant issues. In contrast, his teaching methods are seen as overly simplistic, making it hard for students to achieve good grades despite the supportive and friendly nature of the professor himself.

Ratings.comment: This guy was terrible.  He speaks to soft to hear and has a thick accent.  He does not help out after class, EVER!  He does not care about his students grades.  And he is very childish about little things that bug him.  He is an extremely hard grader and impossible to work with.  Absolutely the worst professor I've ever had and I am graduating now

I though Randall was great. He valued learning, not grades, and made time to help me with the material. I definitely worked my tail off studying for his exams, but he is still a thorough teacher, and a really nice guy. Definitely one of my favorite teachers.

This class was impossibly hard. His lectures are simple, but his tests and homework are so complicated it's almost impossible to get a good grade. He's a nice guy, but not sympathetic to any problems. He doesn't hold office hours and when I said I needed help, he said I should just read the slide again.

summary_comment: Professor Abudllaev is knowledgeable about his subject matter and provides insightful answers to questions. However, his lectures are often described as boring and difficult to follow due to excessive use of PowerPoint slides and a lack of clear organization. Despite the ease of the class, students find the teaching style to be ineffective for engaging with the material.
summary_comment_short: Professor Abudllaev is knowledgeable about the subject matter and provides insightful answers to questions, but his teaching style is largely criticized for being boring and disorganized, with many students finding the lectures difficult to follow and unengaging. Despite this, the class is generally considered easy, with some students noting the midterms are straightforward.

Ratings.comment: SO boring but the class is easy. so many power points that i started bringing other work to class. The midterms are pretty easy though.

Incredibly disorganized. Slides have so much information on them that its impossible to read all of it before it is changed.  mumbles through lectures with no discernable lesson plan. Knowledgable but not skilled as a teacher
Easy class, but be ready to sit through power points all class every class

I had the 501 section on Central Asia (most of the 'stan countries). The class was incredibly boring, and I never paid attention. The readings are terribly disorganized. They're not put in any particular order and have several page numbers written on them. I gave up after he handed us a 60 page packet of readings held together with a paper clip.
Knows A LOT about the subject matter and has a lot of insight. Anytime you ask a question he always has the answer. The lectures...welll....painfull..I would rather pound my head against the wall.
Boring lectures but good insights and easy class...very interesting guy
No Comments
This course was about Central Asia, interesting class. He is from that area himself so he has a great knowledge about the material, very nice guy! lectures are boring but Easy class.

summary_comment: Professor Kalu is highly regarded for his passion and ability to challenge students to think critically, making his courses both demanding and rewarding. Students find his material challenging but deeply valuable, citing significant learning gains despite the difficulty. However, some find his classes demanding in terms of reading and writing, with exams requiring substantial effort and preparation.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kalu is highly regarded for his passion and ability to challenge students to think critically, making his classes both engaging and demanding. His courses require significant reading and effort, but students find them deeply rewarding, citing substantial learning gains despite the difficulty.

Ratings.comment: One of the BEST profs I've had at OSU. He is passionate about the topic which makes class more interesting. He also challenges you to critically think- something not always required in courses. The readings are required, but manageable with basic time management. Dr. Kalu is very helpful and worth taking!

He is one of the smartest people I have ever met in my life, his classes are difficult...but it's worth it. I have learned more from him than most other professors combined. Read, go to lecture and pay attention and you should do well.

Class is hard.  Professor makes you read A LOT of boring crap then just wants you to tell him what you learned from the readings but doesn't explain anything clearly.  Does not give notes.  Writes various words on the board but thats it.  Exams are all essay based, wrote 8 pages for the midterm!! and there is a 10page paper due as well.boring & har

summary_comment: Professor Pantsov is highly regarded for his exceptional knowledge and passion for his subject, making his lectures engaging and memorable. Students consistently praise his enthusiasm and ability to captivate the audience, noting that his classes are never dull and are deeply informative. His teaching approach emphasizes active participation and thorough preparation, though students advise coming to lectures and studying diligently to succeed.
summary_comment_short: Professor Pantsov is highly regarded for his exceptional knowledge and passion for his subject, making his lectures engaging and memorable. Students consistently praise his enthusiasm and ability to captivate the class, though some note that preparation and attentiveness are crucial for success.

Ratings.comment: You get it, yeah? -This dude rocked!

To say that Dr. Pantsov knows his material would be a gross understatement. I have never before meet anyone with such an interest in a topic combined with a true fire in sharing it with others. The man is truly brilliant, and he's also a great guy. You will WANT to go to his lectures. A great teacher, not just a professor. Study the study guide.
Very good at holding attention, very passionate when he speaks. Great accent, and a funny guy!

If you have a chance, you really must take this class. Pantsov is interesting, passionate, and extremely intelligent. There is never ever a boring moment, and most importantly, you learn so much over the course of 9 weeks.  Tests are hard and you need to know your stuff, but if you pay attention and take notes, you'll find it's well worth it!
great

I went to one class because I couldn't understand his Russian version of English. If you go to class, I heard he is the type who loves to call on people randomly, so know your material. You can easily get an A in this class if you have a good memory and the ability to BS an essay.

Enthusiastic prof who's very excited by what he teaches.  His voice isn't monotone-a definite plus for a night class. He gives a study sheet with 10 essay questions and identifications. Too bad you don't know which question you would get on the test. Take good notes and don't fall asleep, that helps in memorizing 4000 years of Chinese history.
Very animated.  Definitely go to lecture and do readings.

This class is never boring.  I recommend you not miss any classes- the tests are hard, but fair.  Dr Pantsov is very, very interesting and willing to help where he can.  Go to office hours if you need to.
Prof's animation keeps the tempo up; don't miss class.

summary_comment: Professor Yosha has an unconventional teaching style that can be off-putting, frequently veering into tangents unrelated to the course material. Despite this, students acknowledge his kindness and find value in the easy A grade they receive. Overall, his effectiveness as a teacher is questioned due to the limited depth of learning provided in his classes.
summary_comment_short: Professor Yosha has an odd teaching style that often veers off-topic, which some students find frustrating despite his efforts to be helpful. Overall, however, his approach results in easy grades, though many feel they could have learned less effectively through self-study.

Ratings.comment: Sort of agree with the previous poster but wouldn't be quite as harsh. I still learned from him but his teaching style is definitely pretty odd. When he lectures he frequently goes off on weird tangents that aren't at all related to the course material. Not what I thought I signed up for but he's a nice guy and I got an easy A so no hard feelings
He was not a good teacher. He means well and is a sweet guy, but I could have learned more by reading the article on Wikipedia about Globalization than in his class.

summary_comment: Professor Donald is highly regarded for making his class engaging and relevant, particularly through discussions of current issues. His open-book tests and quizzes make the material accessible, though some find the content and lectures somewhat disconnected from the assessments. Overall, his courses are considered easy but rewarding in terms of learning.
summary_comment_short: Professor Donald is known for his engaging and relevant teaching style, often discussing current issues and using open-book tests and quizzes, making the class accessible for Information Systems majors. His lectures are generally considered easy, with minimal required preparation outside of reading the books, though some find the material lacks depth and relevance.

Ratings.comment: Very interesting class. Talks a lot about current issues. Open book tests and quizes. Great for IS majors.

Good Class, Very interesting teacher. One of the best classes ive been to was when the FT. Hood shootings happened. He is very passionate about the issues. the tests are at home/open book so they arent very hard, but most of the lectures have nothing to do with the book or the tests. Its pretty much common sense. For S&I students its a must take.
He is the bomb. He is so cool and he really keeps class interesting. His class is really easy, but you do learn a lot. I'm going to miss him next quarter!
This guy rocks! Took him in the summer. Attendance not mandatory but classes are interesting. Being a sociology major, its nice to finally take a class that is actually interesting and relevant.

i didnt like the class. it was easy, but you need the books in order to pass the take home exam. the book are like $100+. so it wasnt worth it. only graded 5 times. honestly if you want to learn take anita bucknam. its an easy course that makes your brain lazy. he spend most of his time relating to ex army guys. i felt like i wasted my time.
Really good guy, lots of interesting storied.  Very easy, I wish he had actually taught more...he relies more on students to keep the class going. Extremely cool!
Easiest class but you still have work to do and you learn a lot. If you take it and you give presentations do not look at your slides. Besides that it is really easy.
The class is extremely easy. Two tests all quarter and both were take home. One paper that has to be like 3 pages and a small presentation. Piece of cake.

Very easy, laid back class. Attendance not mandatory. Graded on take-home exams, 3 pg paper and a presentation. The book is online on google.books so no need to buy it. If you need an easy A, this is it.
Easiest class ever, death by power point but Mr. Donald is an awesome teacher

Such a great teacher. Not hard at all, but you still learn a ton. His experience in the military really helps with understanding the class, as he makes many references to it while trying to explain a point. I would take his class again in a heartbeat!

I think this teacher mainly teaches military science classes for ROTC, he seemed to already know most of the ROTC students in the class. He is pretty laid back and accomodating if you have scheduling conflicts. The class has as lot of reading, but if you go to class he will reitterate everything that you need to know from the reading. As far as hom
